availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Clay Meriwether (Louisville, Kentucky, physician and soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Son of David H. Meriweather and Lydia Meriweather. Physician in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a captain from September 1862 to July 1863. Captured with John Hunt Morgan in July 1863. Prisoner of war from July 1863 to October 1864 when he was exchanged and paroled.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 306A.

Adam Rankin Johnson, The Partisan Rangers of the Confederate States Army, ed. William J. Davis (G. G. Fetter Company, 1904), 327-329.
